title: Was the South Democrat or Republican during the Civil War? - Quora
tags: History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: This is a complex question that isn’t quite as simple as Republican or Democrat. The republican party was only established in the 1850s as a result of the collapse of the Whig party, primarily due to splits in the Whig and Democratic party over allowing slavery in the new western territories. Whig Party Democratic Party Republican Party founded Since the Republican party was an anti-slavery party, it makes sense that the majority of those in the south were Democrats (or what was left of the Whig party.) During the war the primary political party in the South were Southern Democrats. While technically part of the same Democratic Party, they were actually distinct from the Northern Democrats. In fact, they ran a different presidential candidate from the Northern Democrats in the election of 1860, which is how Lincoln won the presidency as a Republican (he had formerly been a Whig). Southern Democrats - Wikipedia After the Civil war the South remained a predominately Democratic stronghold because the Northern Democrats and Republicans, who controlled the North and Federal government, were still trying to reform Southern race laws. Of course, all this changed in the 60s after LBJ passed the Civil rights act. Southern Democrats, known as Dixiecrats, were strongly against its passage, but Republicans and northern Democrats helped get it passed. The result was that the Dixiecrats started voting for Republicans, and more blacks, who had overwhelmingly supported Republicans, started voting for Democrats. Now, the republican party is strongly entrenched in those former Confederate States, and you will find the remnants of the KKK, are now primarily Republicans.
